comment.body: I think OSSL_PARAM_set_utf8_ptr just sets a pointer, and `buildinfo` would not be valid anymore after the function returns.

Hmm, strdup malloc's memory and I suspect this way it will lead to a memory leak.

Couldn't you assemble the build info string with a #define? No runtime info seems to be needed to do this. Then it can be safely set with OSSL_PARAM_set_utf8_ptr.
I interpret the documentation that it really just sets the pointer: https://www.openssl.org/docs/manmaster/man3/OSSL_PARAM_utf8_ptr.html
:-( Nothing too small to not be forgotten. Thanks.
